title: Getting Started
text: First, need train model:

title: Getting Started
text: model trained, can compute posterior probability Granger causal relationship follows: row tibble, cause_var causing variable, effect_var affected variable, prob posterior probability cause_var causing effect_var. case, strong evidence y1 (1st variable) Granger-causing y2 (2nd variable), way around.

title: Getting Started
text: similar, can summarize posterior distribution IRFs follows: row tibble, horizon IRF horizon, cause_var effect_var defined , irf posterior mean IRF, lb ub represent 90% credible interval IRF.

title: Getting Started
text: Finally, can summarize (1 dimensional) posterior predictive pdfs follows: row tibble, horizon prediction horizon, var target variable, y point pdf evaluated, pdf value posterior predictive pdf y.

title: Getting Started
text: Instead summarizying results tibble, can summarize ggplot using following functions:

title: Getting Started
text: Finally, can extract raw chains main variables model using following functions:

title: Installation
text: BNPGrangerTestR requires Julia v1.9.1+. can download , install following instructions.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Iván Gutiérrez. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gutiérrez (2023). BNPGrangerTestR: Bayesian Nonparametric Granger Causality Test. R package version 0.1.0, https://igutierrezm.github.io/BNPGrangerTestR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {BNPGrangerTestR: A Bayesian Nonparametric Granger Causality Test},   author = {Iván Gutiérrez},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://igutierrezm.github.io/BNPGrangerTestR/}, }

what: A Bayesian Nonparametric Granger Causality Test
title: A Bayesian Nonparametric Granger Causality Test
text: R package implements (BNP) Granger causality test described Gutiérrez et al. (2023). See documentation details getting started vignette example.

title: A Bayesian Nonparametric Granger Causality Test
text: can install BNPGrangerTestR source follows: install R package BNPGrangerTestR, Julia packages depends. order install Julia packages, run need . BNPGrangerTestR requires Julia v1.6.1+. can download , install following instructions.

what: Perform the Granger causality test described in Gutiérrez et al. (2023). — bnpgrangertest
title: Perform the Granger causality test described in Gutiérrez et al. (2023). — bnpgrangertest
text: Perform Granger causality test described Gutiérrez et al. (2023).

title: Perform the Granger causality test described in Gutiérrez et al. (2023). — bnpgrangertest
code: bnpgrangertest(   Y,   p = 1L,   z0 = 1,   q0 = 1,   a0p = 1,   b0p = 1,   a0s = 8,   b0s = 4,   v0 = ncol(Y) + 1L,   S0 = diag(ncol(Y)),   warmup = 2000L,   iter = 4000L,   thin = 1L,   hmax = 1L,   seed = 1L,   grid_npoints = 50L,   grid_lbs = apply(Y, 2, function(x) mean(x) - 3 * stats::sd(x)),   grid_ubs = apply(Y, 2, function(x) mean(x) + 3 * stats::sd(x)) )

title: Perform the Granger causality test described in Gutiérrez et al. (2023). — bnpgrangertest
text: Y \(T \times N\) response matrix \(T\) periods. p number lags model. z0 hyperparameter \(\zeta_{0}\). q0 hyperparameter \(q_{0} := \sigma_{0}^{2}\). a0p hyperparameter \(a_{0p}\). b0p hyperparameter \(b_{0p}\). a0s hyperparameter \(a_{0s}\). b0s hyperparameter \(b_{0s}\). v0 hyperparameter \(v_{0}\). S0 hyperparameter \(S_{0}\). warmup number warmup mcmc iterations. iter total number mcmc iterations. thin period saving samples. hmax maximum horizon computing IRFs posterior predictive pdfs. seed seed random number generation. grid_npoints number points y0 computing posterior predictive pdf. final grid ith variable conformed `grid_npoints` equispaced points grid_lbs[] grid_ubs[],  see arguments grid_lb grid_ub. grid_lbs vector lower bounds, see grid_npoints. grid_ubs vector upper bounds, see grid_npoints.

title: Perform the Granger causality test described in Gutiérrez et al. (2023). — bnpgrangertest
text: object class bnpgrangertest.

title: Extract the full MCMC chain associated to \(\gamma\). — extract_chain_gamma
text: tibble chain \(\gamma\) following variables: iter: MCMC iteration. cause_var: causing variable relationship. effect_var: affected variable relationship. value: value target variable current iteration.

title: Extract the full MCMC chain associated to the IRFs. — extract_chain_irf
text: tibble chain IRFs following variables: iter: MCMC iteration. horizon: IRF horizon. cause_var: causing variable relationship. effect_var: affected variable relationship. value: value target variable current iteration.

title: Extract the full MCMC chain associated to the (1d) posterior predictive pdfs. — extract_chain_pdf
text: tibble chain (1d) posterior predictive pdfs following variables: iter: MCMC iteration. horizon: IRF horizon. var: variable predictive pdf computed. value: value target variable current iteration.

title: Summarize the posterior distribution of the IRFs. — summarize_irf
Summarize the posterior distribution of the IRFs. — summarize_irf
text: object instance class bnpgrangertest. qlb quantile used computing lower bound CI. qub quantile used computing lower bound CI.

title: Summarize the posterior distribution of the IRFs. — summarize_irf
text: tibble posterior mean requested IRF, following variables: horizon: IRF horizon. `cause_id`: causing variable relationship. `effect_id`: affected variable relationship. `irf`: posterior mean IRF.

title: Summarize the posterior predictive distribution. — summarize_pdf
text: tibble posterior predictive pdf, following variables: horizon: IRF horizon. cause_var: causing variable relationship. effect_var: affected variable relationship. y: grid point. pdf: posterior predictive pdf.
